2025-05-26T04:31:34.544600Z ‚Äî assistant

The iPad Magic Keyboard (the one with the floating hinge and trackpad) is designed specifically for iPads and connects via the Smart Connector ‚Äî not Bluetooth or USB ‚Äî so:

  • No, you cannot use it with your Mac mini (unless you‚Äôre talking about a separate Magic Keyboard that pairs via Bluetooth ‚Äî let me know if that's what you meant).
  • No, it won‚Äôt work with your iPhone either ‚Äî the Smart Connector interface isn't compatible with iOS devices.

Alternatives in the Meantime:

If you want to use a keyboard with your Mac mini or iPhone: - Consider a Bluetooth keyboard (like Apple‚Äôs standalone Magic Keyboard or any third-party one). - Or if you have a USB keyboard, you can plug it directly into the Mac mini or use an adapter for the iPhone with a Lightning or USB-C to USB-A/C dongle.

If you did buy the Bluetooth version of the Magic Keyboard (not the iPad Smart Connector one), then yes ‚Äî you can pair it with both the Mac mini and the iPhone.

Want help confirming which one you actually bought? Just send the model number or a photo of the box.

  • It does not use Bluetooth, USB-C, or any wireless pairing method.
  • It will not work at all with your Mac mini or iPhone, even physically ‚Äî the Smart Connector pins only align with the iPad Pro's body and magnetic dock.
  • It won‚Äôt power on or function unless attached to the M4 iPad Pro itself.

It‚Äôs a gorgeous and premium keyboard ‚Äî but totally iPad-exclusive. You‚Äôll have to wait until the new iPad arrives to put it to use.
